rComments: Lets say this first, tax is already complicated and not an easy class if you're pursuing CPA. But professor Tom does an excellent job on teaching. If you attend all his lectures and take notes, you literally can save your time from reading the thick book. His exams are fair and allow you to use 6 page notes. Honestly, the best SC professor in Tax !

Class is not mandatory but he passes out a sign in sheet at every class. He tells you beforehand if he plans on collecting a homework assignment. The course reader is really helpful if you don't go to class but I really recommend going to class. Chapter quizzes after each chapter. Take notes in class and write down every example and you'll be fine.

Probably the best professor I've had at UCSC in terms of clarity and learning a lot from. There were 15 quizzes and he dropped the 5 lowest ones. The tests were fair and he lets you use your own notes for them. Should be able to do well as long as you put some effort in the class.

Best professor I've had during my entire 4-years at UCSC. This class is not the easiest but Prof Moschetti teaches it so well. His attitude and enthusiasm makes his lectures interesting and easy to follow. Even at 8 a.m., I was wide awake and engaged. Pay attention and take notes in class!
He makes this class super easy. Easy A if you pay attention in class.

dont read the book its useless just use it for the problems. RECORD HIS LECTURES because thats whats on the midterms. Tax is not a interesting subject but its easy to understand because professor moschetti breaks it down really well

He is very helpful, and he knows what he is talking about. This is a difficult class "that's why CPAs make so much money". If you want to get good grades from the class, you have to read the book. You are allowed to use cheat sheet, but even then it is hard to get As, but it is not impossible (I got A-). Also there are tricky short quizzes.

This class is a joke. Tests are extremely hard. Tax is boring and they put it at 8 Am. The teacher is very hard to get an A with. If you just want to pass its easy but getting an A is hard. Tests basically are up to how good your TA's are. They run the review and they see the test before hard. So see how stingy the TA's are before taking the course

I have to say, this is probably the most challenging classes in the accounting series. However, Moschetti probably was one of the best professor's you'll have at UCSC. He is very clear in his lectures and never seems to lose anyone. Very approachable. There are no sections for this class but the TAs review sessions for the exams were very helpful.

By far one of the best prof. in the BME accounting focus courses. Tax is really hard but Tom just makes it so crystal clear. Lecture is hard, tests are fair, must work for a decent grade but you learn a lot.
